meanings: take advantage of a person´s unguarded moment
take a person off his guard

examples.korean: Tax can be a minefield for the unwary. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 방심한 사람들에게는 세금이 지뢰밭이 될 수도 있다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Tax can be a minefield for the unwary. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: It was something I’d let out in an unguarded moment. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그것은 내가 순간적으로 방심하는 바람에 내뱉은 것이었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: It was something I’d let out in an unguarded moment. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Whether it's Google or Apple or free software, we've got some fantastic competitors and it keeps us on our toes. (Bill Gates) 듣기 Add to Wordbook 우리에겐 구글, 애플, 다른 무료 소프트웨어 등 우리를 방심하지 않게 할 멋진 경쟁자들이 있다. (빌 게이츠, 겸손명언) 명언/속담
examples.english: Whether it's Google or Apple or free software, we've got some fantastic competitors and it keeps us on our toes. (Bill Gates) Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: You snooze, you lose. You should have prepared in advance. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 방심하다가 큰코다치지. 너는 미리 준비해야 했어. 국제영어대학원대학교 신어사전
examples.english: You snooze, you lose. You should have prepared in advance. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: lay a person asleep[to sleep, to rest] 듣기 Add to Wordbook 남을 잠자게[방심하게, 영면하게] 하다. Friendict Level English-Korean Dictionary
